comments:
This report is probably somewhat wrongly placed, given the stack trace. But I'm not sure where it should go otherwise (com.ibm.icu.* ?) , so I settle for assigning it to the perceived top location...please reassign if required.

Eclipse 3.2M6

I try to invoke 'Build all' in my update site. It quickly comes back with an error message box for 'Export Plug-ins' and I find the stack trace below. If I retry, it works...

!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.jobs 4 2 2006-04-04 10:36:54.556
!MESSAGE An internal error occurred during: "Export Plug-ins".
!STACK 0
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 6
	at com.ibm.icu.util.Calendar.formatHelper(Calendar.java:3069)
	at com.ibm.icu.util.Calendar.getDateTimeFormat(Calendar.java:3020)
	at com.ibm.icu.text.DateFormat.get(DateFormat.java:943)
	at com.ibm.icu.text.DateFormat.getDateTimeInstance(DateFormat.java:736)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.launching.StandardVMRunner.renderProcessLabel(StandardVMRunner.java:47)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.launching.StandardVMRunner.run(StandardVMRunner.java:252)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.launching.AbstractVMInstall.evaluateSystemProperties(AbstractVMInstall.java:374)
	at org.eclipse.pde.internal.core.ExecutionEnvironmentAnalyzer.analyze(ExecutionEnvironmentAnalyzer.java:98)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.launching.environments.Analyzer.analyze(Analyzer.java:41)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.launching.environments.EnvironmentsManager.analyze(EnvironmentsManager.java:295)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.launching.environments.EnvironmentsManager.initializeCompatibilities(EnvironmentsManager.java:200)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.launching.environments.ExecutionEnvironment.init(ExecutionEnvironment.java:64)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.launching.environments.ExecutionEnvironment.getDefaultVM(ExecutionEnvironment.java:101)
	at org.eclipse.pde.internal.core.exports.BuildUtilities.getBootClasspath(BuildUtilities.java:30)
	at org.eclipse.pde.internal.core.exports.FeatureExportOperation.createAntBuildProperties(FeatureExportOperation.java:350)
	at org.eclipse.pde.internal.core.exports.FeatureExportOperation.doExport(FeatureExportOperation.java:189)
	at org.eclipse.pde.internal.core.exports.FeatureBasedExportOperation.run(FeatureBasedExportOperation.java:46)
	at org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.build.FeatureExportJob.run(FeatureExportJob.java:53)
	at org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.build.BuildSiteJob.run(BuildSiteJob.java:65)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)
I get the exact same error when trying to launch a build.xml file using ant.

I get this when launching a new IDE also.

Looking at the stacktrace I now believe this makes most sense to JDT, considering that it's the renderProcessLabel method that is last in the eclipse namespace...?
Moving to JDT Debug since 'org.eclipse.jdt.internal.launching.StandardVMRunner' belongs there.

Just want to up the severity of this - I can not launch a debug session (regular works though), which makes things a bit unnecessarily tricky :-)

Having said that, I can confirm that it is a Locale issue - I use Swedish settings. Setting to English/United States it seems to work. I haven't yet been able to narrow it down to exactly which setting causes the problem though.

So, this is a workaround, but not very palatable...I hope this can be addressed fairly quickly.
Doug, is this a known bug in ICU4J?  Kenneth is using Swedish regional settings.
I was also on a workstation with Swedish locale when the problem occurred.

(In reply to comment #5)
Yes, this is fixed in ICU4J 3.4.4, which I was planning to send to you today or
tomorrow.

Closing, as this is a bug in ICU, not Eclipse.  Version 3.4.4 of ICU4J should be in Eclipse 3.2, likely for the next milestone.  ICU bugs can be logged at:
http://bugs.icu-project.org/cgi-bin/icu-bugs

(In reply to comment #8)
> Closing, as this is a bug in ICU, not Eclipse.  Version 3.4.4 of ICU4J should
> be in Eclipse 3.2, likely for the next milestone.  ICU bugs can be logged at:
> http://bugs.icu-project.org/cgi-bin/icu-bugs
> 

Well, as it appears this has already been fixed, no point in logging it there again.

Waiting to the next Eclipse milestone is not very convenient. If I understand comment #7 correctly ICU 3.4.4 is already done. Considering it is a single plugin and that the version numbers indicate bugfixes that I assume does not violate interfaces etc, would it be possible to make a com.ibm.ico_3.4.4.jar available for patching my M6?

Actually, I have already tried to take 3.4.4 directly from the ICU site, but as that is not a bona fide plugin, I'm unsure if you massage it a bit more to make things work...

An ICU4J plugin is built for Eclipse and is not available via the ICU site as each new revision requires approval from the Eclipse foundation before it can be made available in the Eclipse builds.  This process is not yet complete.
*** Bug 135620 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 135798 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

> An ICU4J plugin is built for Eclipse and is not available via the ICU site as
> each new revision requires approval from the Eclipse foundation before it can
> be made available in the Eclipse builds.  This process is not yet complete.
>
If it isn't too much work to complete that process, then please, double please, do it soon. Or at least provide an instruction that would enable us to create such a plugin from ICU4J 3.4.4.

I can't dictate the speed of that process as it is done by the Eclipse Foundation.  I cannot provide instruction as to how to create such a plugin from ICU3.4.4 as it was done by the ICU group and is not a trivial process.
Starting eclipse with arguments -nl en_US seems to be a temporary solution. At least for me.
Kevin, see comment #7 - this bug is fixed in ICU4J 3.4.4.
*** Bug 137103 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 136291 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

I wish to reopen this bug to ensure it stays on the radar...I note that ICU 3.4.3 is not in 3.2RC1 - it'd be a shame to not have this fixed for 3.2 final.

As an aside, even if the bug is in ICU or not, we must have an Eclipse built plugin of ICU - as a 'consumer' of Eclipse, this makes it an Eclipse bug, regardless.

(In reply to comment #19)
> I wish to reopen this bug to ensure it stays on the radar...I note that ICU
> 3.4.3 is not in 3.2RC1 - it'd be a shame to not have this fixed for 3.2 final.

Doh. Typo in the version number. Should be: '...ICU 3.4.4 is not...'
ICU 3.4.4 is released into the 3.2 build now.

I'm guessing this is caused by the same bug, but I'll just mention it here: In swedish locale I cannot install any plugins. All I get is a message saying "No features found on the selected site(s). Choose a different site or site category." Changing to US locale fixes this problem.

Which build are you using when you see the update problem?  Are there any exceptions in the log file (see Error Log view or .log file in workspace's .metadata folder).  Try a build > 20060418 and if you still have the same problem then open a new bug.
I can reproduce with I20060419-1640. There are no entries in the log file. Opened bug 137887.

I think you should test one of the latest nightly builds, 20060420 or 20060421, instead since the problem mentioned in this thread doesn't seem to have been fixed in the integration build you tested despite what is stated above.
OK - where do I find them? (I've never used anything other than milestone builds before)
Yes I wasn't specific enough in my last comment.  I should have said try a nightly build.
*** Bug 137921 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

http://www.eclipse.org/downloads/index_project.php
Select Platform
There will be a nightly build listed below the latest integration build.  Note that the 0421 nightly build was deemed unusable so try N0420 instead.
It worked ok with N20060420-0010. I closed the other bug. Thanks!
*** Bug 138328 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 138329 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 138146 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 138146 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Verified this error no longer happens in N20060425-0010 when running in se locale.  But now a different problem is occurring - see bug 138243.
That last comment should say see bug 138423.
